definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: An enormous heaviness was coming over me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然感到有种巨大的沉重感压迫着我。

sentences.english: Among the whites in the United States it is only the reactionary ruling circles who oppress the black people.
sentences.chinese: 在美国压迫黑人的，只是白色人种中的反动统治集团。

sentences.english: He was single -mindedly devoted to the hastening of freedom for the oppressed.
sentences.chinese: 他一心一意致力于早日让被压迫者获得自由。

sentences.english: Stop any bleeding injury by applying direct pressure to the wound.
sentences.chinese: 如有流血的外伤，立即直接压迫伤处止血。

sentences.english: Echocardiography showed a pericardial cystic mass with external compression of the right ventricle.
sentences.chinese: 心脏超音波显示心脏旁有一水泡状囊肿且压迫右心室。

sentences.english: NIKOLAY DAVYDENKO: Shock, maybe just for press shocked, because Nadal always winning here.
sentences.chinese: 很雷，但是是压迫的雷，因为纳达尔在这儿总能赢。

sentences.english: Obviously the solution is to resist and overthrow the oppressors.
sentences.chinese: 显然，解决办法就是对抗并推翻这些压迫者。

sentences.english: The Lord restores justice and secures the rights of the oppressed.
sentences.chinese: 上主常行正义的工作，为受压迫者主持公道。

sentences.english: Why would a liberal support a regime that oppresses and imprisons its people?
sentences.chinese: 为什么自由派支持的政权会压迫和禁锢它的人民呢？

sentences.english: The forest depths, by foot unpressed.
sentences.chinese: 林深处，未经世人脚印压迫。

sentences.english: You’ll most likely feel pain as inflamed tendons, muscles or joints pinch on nerves.
sentences.chinese: 当肌腱发炎，肌肉或关节压迫神经时你会感到疼痛。

sentences.english: There's a history of the underdog using standup comedy to speak truth to power.
sentences.chinese: 向来都有被压迫的人借滑稽说笑向当权者说出真相。

sentences.english: This is accomplished by pressing the balls together from the back of the rack toward the apex ball.
sentences.chinese: 借由从向顶球的架背面一起压迫球这是完成的。

sentences.english: In the relationship of power structure and frame, which is the system of structure oppressing us.
sentences.chinese: 在权力结构关系与体制下，是结构压迫了我们。
人民受尽了不公正的压迫。

sentences.english: Several heads were symbolic of decadence and oppression, and also of heresy.
sentences.chinese: 几个头是象征性的衰落和压迫，和并且异端邪说。

definition: to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
